Hey there! Remember the water poster contest? Here is an update from Ms. Tina in 2nd grade:

2nd grade is proud to announce that Oliver Shepherd-Powell won 1st place, and Gabriel Visingard won 2nd in the Every Drop Counts poster contest sponsored by the town of Boone. The boys spent time learning about the water cycle, the importance of fresh water, as well as ways to conserve it. Then, they created posters to teach others what they learned. The judges said it was a very difficult decision, as there were many beautiful posters submitted. Congratulations boys!
(there will be pictures later when the boys are presented with their prizes at a Town Council meeting)

From Ms. Tina in 2nd Grade:
2nd grade has participated for 2 years in the Doves for Peace classroom exchange. Classes of all ages from around the world exchange paper doves with one another as a gesture of friendship. Many classes also decide to take it a step further and exchange letters, cards, and videos or participate together in digital projects. This year, 2nd grade has collaborated with K and 4 to send doves and peace posters to schools in Turkey, Mexico, and India. Our doves have been received in Turkey, and we are going to exchange New Year's cards as well! (Pictures are of our friends in Turkey with their doves, and the collaborative peace posters 2nd grade sent to each class, 4th grade and Kinders with their Peace Doves) @ Two Rivers Community School
